comment: Professor Gooding was amazing. Loved her. Loved the class. She was so kind and caring. She really wants all of her students to succeed. It was a wonderful opportunity, I would take the class again if I could.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Caring

comment: I had to do a whole course in 4 weeks since it was a summer course. Nothing was cut out. One of the most difficult courses I have EVER taken.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I took ANTH 1105 as an online summer class and was incredibly difficult. Tests are 100 questions. Be careful, will require a lot of reading and self learning. (All of it is done in 4 weeks).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Tests will include random facts in obscure places in your textbook.  Impossible to memorize every word, so tough to get 'A' on tests.  Weekly reading quizzes and labs are easy. That helps overall grades    She blessed us in the Final by giving us extra time to take the exam.  That really helped. She enjoys what she teaches. Very pleasant person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I am currently enrolled her in Intro to Physical Anthropology and it has been an absolute disaster. Me and other classmates have filled her inbox with multiple emails because she did not grade for 8 WEEKS, but she never responded until we got in contact with the head of the anthropology department and it was just an announcement on D2L. Beware!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I was super enthusiastic about the human skeleton class ANTH 2223. Gooding is super funny and makes learning easier by giving us connections how to remember certain terminology. Due to the 7 week class the workload was very heavy... I did enjoy the studying though, and she was really nice with grading and gave an extra credit opportunity.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Fantastic teacher and very engaging!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Hilarious--Respected

comment: Took both human skeleton and human origins. Dr. Gooding is one of my favorite professors at KSU. Hilarious and down to earth. Expects you to put in work and know the material, but is very understanding of her students. Very knowledgeable and passionate. Get the textbook, show up to class and study, you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Amazing teacher with a lot of expertise and knowledge in the field. Her lectures are really good and even though attendance isn't mandatory, you need the lecture. There were moments when she would be really confusing and asking questions did not always clear things up. Thankfully she had a lot of great TAs. She will NOT bump your grade, dont ask
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This class is a writing based class. All of the articles are provided. Make sure to give yourself time to read and understand the articles before the quizzes and to prepare for the essays. Dr. Gooding gives great instruction on what she wants in the papers. The writing days are so helpful and are free 100s.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is heavy on memorizing material. GET THE BOOK and use all of the study tips and materials that are provided. Open lab days are so helpful! If you don't come to class, you probably won't pass. Dr. Gooding is a tough grader but she cares about you and your education and is there to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lots of studying and memorization but Dr. Gooding is an amazing professor. Come to class and any open lab days and you should do just fine. And make sure to get (and read) the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Absolutely incredible professor. Always open to questions (no matter how stupid). Amazing lectures. Very informative. Lectures clearly cover what will be on the tests. Open to critiques about the online tests and their inaccurate answers. Used the word "bamboozled" in response to a student's question. 10/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She was an awesome professor. She made topics interesting and had a very clear grading criterion. She is easily accessible outside of class and very approachable. However, don't take her kindness for weakness. The class is very reading and memorization-heavy. She doesn't just hand out grades. An A is very doable if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very good professor who answers all questions and is very entertaining and class engaging
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: ANTH 4490 Intro to Forensic Medicine was a great class. It was reading heavy but the material was interesting. Readings were available online. Dr. Gooding taught amazing lectures and gave good feedback. Some of the material was difficult but the case analysis assignments were interesting and gave a more in-depth look at forensic medicine.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Great Professor, gives you term lists and lectures.... Textbook is necessary and a lot of studying. Take advantage of daily lab time and study!! If you dont go to class you wont pass
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Gooding is easily the best professor i've ever had. Any class she teaches - TAKE IT! She's extremely knowledgeable and is happy to share her expertise. While attendance isn't mandatory, it's really a must if you want a good grade. She makes the material fun and interesting and is very clear about grading criteria.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Inspirational

comment: Anthropology of the Human Skeleton. Professor Gooding is very sarcastic but cares about your education! Pay attention in class and study what she says and you will pass this challenging course feeling smart and accomplished.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Gooding is one of my favorite proffesors I have had. She is a phenominal teacher and continuolsy strives to reach all of her students. This class is a hard class, but she is always available for extra helpwith papers. Grading criteria is ver clear and the labs are fun! Few quizzes mostly papers. The class is worth it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Gooding treats you like an adult - doesn't take attendance, but is honest in telling you that you need to show to get a good grade. Teaches for you to actually learn the material, not sleep through the course. She's no BS. Do the work, show up, talk to her if you're having problems and you'll do fine. Knowledgable, fun, definite recommend!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Gooding makes this class challenging but fun. BE FAMILIAR WITH CMS WRITING! The articles she assigns for coursework can take a few rereads to get your head around. If you miss class , the best solution is to reread the articles again. DO NOT MISS PAPER DEADLINES. Overall, a class i didn't think i needed, but I thoroughly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Get ready to read

comment: Gooding is a tough grader, but fair and clear on what wants. She's an excellent professor as well and truly wants you to succeed in her class and sets you up to do so. You have to work though, this isn't a class you can just show up in and get an A. Do the readings, make corrections on your papers where she tells you to, and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is a writing class, she'll tell you that on the first day so if you don't like writing this class isn't for you. However if you struggle with writing and you are willing to learn to better yourself you will do well in the class. There is usually three scientific journals you will have to read and a lab then you'll do a paper.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Gooding was PHENOMENAL! Helpful, extremely knowledgeable, and so much fun. Her lectures are interesting and useful, but the biggest part of this class is working with the bones. ASK QUESTIONS if you have them, she will help you succeed! Spend time reading your book and really understanding functions and connections. Definitely recommend! A+++
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Not going to sugar coat it, this class was hard. You really have to work for your grade. BUT Dr. Gooding is an amazing professor and wants to help you in any way she can. 10 labs, 3 tests, 1 partner project and extra credit. Lectures are interesting but make sure to take good notes. It is super hard to cram for these tests so study bit by bit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Forensic Anthro - Loved it This was a hard and challenging class. You will have to study, go to class, and work hard for a good grade. Dr. Gooding obviously cares and knows A LOT about the subject. She makes it so fun and interesting. Class is a little long, but you learn a lot. She gives you plenty of hands on time with the bones and material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Gooding makes this class so fun. It's obvious she cares about what she is teaching. You will WANT to go to class because what you are learning is awesome. Dr. Gooding explains everything and the syllabus is straight forward. You will need to study more than the night before the exam if you wan to do good. She rocks.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Gooding is one of my favourite teachers and one of the best I've ever had. Her lectures are very informative and feels more like a discussion or like she's having a conversation with you. She gives you a lot of resources and opportunities to do well. Human origins is a great look into what makes us human and how we fit into the world around us.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: This class will really make you realize how much room we have to work on our writing. I came out of it feeling like I was a better writer. The labs are actually pretty fun and shes a really chill teacher!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Group projects

comment: This teacher will inspire you to do better and succeed. This human origins class I took created a basis for everything Anthropology related and its a must. I have never met a professor that cared more about her job or students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is cool. You learn about monkeys, fossils, and a lot about human evolution. Three tests, not cumulative. She drops your lowest two lab exercises and there is easy online extra credit at the end of the semester. The class is interesting information but you have to pay attention but that's easy to do because the lectures are cool.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Anth of death was fascinating! We discussed tough topics in a respectable way. The assignments are all different so every learning style can succeed. This class can work for anyone who is interested in how we deal with death. Even though it's an anthropological class, nursing majors could benefit from the ethics of talking about death.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: This class taught me how to write a scientific paper and I used the final paper for graduate school admissions. Dr. G also teaches you how to analyze data in excel. This class has fun labs (you get to go to the zoo!). Also offers intro info for different fields in bio anth such as bioarch, bone biomechanics, paleoanth, and forensic anthro.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class is perfect for anyone who is planning to go into a career that relates to anatomy. It is a good class for anyone interested in going to medical school, nursing school, or wants to focus on biological and forensic anthropology. The class is pure memorization the skeleton and is fun and rewarding but you get out of it what you put in.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Caring
